title: Particip-AI: A Democratic Surveying Framework for Anticipating Future AI Use Cases, Harms and Benefits
venue: AAAI/ACM Conference on Artificial Intellignece, Ethics, and Society (AIES)
description: We develop a framework for collecting public opinions on AI and report the public's perceptions on state-of-the-art AI.

title: Can GPT-4 Replicate Empirical Software Engineering Research?
venue: ACM Joint European Software Engineering Conference and Symposium on the Foundations of Software Engineering (ESEC/FSE)
description: We study whether LLMs are able to replicate empirical software engineering papers, including generating assumptions of research methodologies as well as generating code pipelines to repliate quantitative analysies.

title: Counterspeakers' Perspectives: Unveiling Barriers and AI Needs in the Fight against Online Hate
venue: ACM CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems (CHI)
description: We study how AI can assist with fighting online hate speech with counterspeakers who combat toxicity on the web.

title: A Large-Scale Survey on the Usability of AI Programming Assistants: Successes and Challenges
venue: IEEE/ACM International Conference on Software Engineering (ICSE)
description: We study the usability issues that developers encounter when using AI programming assistants, like GitHub Copilot.

title: NLPositionality: Measuring Positionality and Design Biases in Datasets and Models in NLP
venue: Annual Conference of the Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL)
description: We systematically evaluate whose perspectives large language models and NLP datasets align with the most.

title: A Qualitative Study on the Implementation Design Decisions of Developers
venue: IEEE/ACM International Conference on Software Engineering (ICSE)
description: We investigate the types of implementation decisions software developers make, considerations they have, the processes they follow, and the expertise required in this process.

title: Understanding Skills for OSS Communities on GitHub
venue: ACM Joint European Software Engineering Conference and Symposium on the Foundations of Software Engineering (ESEC/FSE)
description: We develop a model of skills that open-source software (OSS) contributors have and investigate how contributors would like to show and develop their skills.

title: Towards Mining OSS Skills from GitHub Activity
venue: IEEE/ACM International Conference on Software Engineering - New Ideas and Emerging Results (ICSE-NIER)
description: We develop a novel approach to skills detection for soft and hard skills relevant to open source software and prototype it in a tool called DISKO.

title: An Exploratory Study of Sharing Strategic Programming Knowledge
venue: ACM CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems (CHI)
description: We investigate the challeges behind articulating, using, and improving on explicit programming strategies.

title: HowToo: A Platform for Sharing, Finding, and Using Programming Strategies
venue: IEEE Visual Languages and Human-Centric Computing (VL/HCC)
description: We study how sharing and collaborating on explicit programming strategies impacts developersâ€™ problem-solving abilities.

title: Whale Watching in Inland Indonesia: Analyzing a Small, Remote, Internet-Based Community Cellular Network
description: We analyze a novel dataset on traffic data to produce insights on a small, remote, internet-based community network.

title: Experiences: Design, Implementation, and Deployment of CoLTE, a Community LTE Solution
venue: ACM International Conference on Mobile Computing and Networking (MobiCom)
description: We report our experiences of building and deploying community-owned and -operated LTE networks in rural areas.

title: An All-in-One Community LTE Network
venue: ACM International Conference on Mobile Computing and Networking (MobiCom)
description: We present our demo for the Community LTE project (CoLTE) to be presented at the Mobicom 2019 conference.
